snippet: A safety board said a driver received too little sleep in the days before a crash in the Bronx last year that killed 15 passengers.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board issues final report on March 2011 crash of a bus returning to Manhattan from a Connecticut casino, killing 15 passengers; agency says that driver Ophadell Williams was sleep-deprived and was speeding at the time of the accident on Interstate 95 in the Bronx.
lead_paragraph: A safety board said a driver received too little sleep in the days before a crash in the Bronx last year that killed 15 passengers.

headline.seo: Fatal Bronx Bus Crash Caused by Driver Fatigue, Board Says
headline.main: Driver Fatigue and Speed Caused Fatal Bus Crash, Investigators Say
headline.print_headline: Driver Fatigue and Speed Led to Bronx Bus Crash That Killed 15, Agency Concludes
